          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a content and sociable introvert who enjoys spending time with close friends but also appreciates solitude.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to a pub to watch the game, potentially with some of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a content and sociable introvert who enjoys spending time with close friends but also appreciates solitude.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with her friends in Victoria Park.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant surroundings.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The King's Head is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jack Taylor -- "Aye, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but wouldn't it be more fun to try somewhere a bit different? Maybe somewhere with a bit more...
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a calm and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and maybe watch a football game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          current daily occupation: likely a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The King's Head.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a friendly and easygoing person who enjoys simple pleasures like spending time with friends and watching football.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and maybe watch a football game.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching soccer games at pubs, and values the company of Jacob Walker and Alexander White.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with his friends in a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching soccer games at pubs, and values the company of Jacob Walker and Alexander White.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and maybe watch a football game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a friendly and easygoing person who enjoys simple pleasures like spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with his friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the sunshine, conversation, and company of his friends.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The King's Head to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Arrive at The King's Head, secure a table, and order drinks.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Enjoy the game with friends, cheering on their preferred team.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The King's Head is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jack Taylor -- "Aye, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but wouldn't it be more fun to try somewhere a bit different? Maybe somewhere with a bit more...
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sporting events.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation, sharing snacks, and basking in the sunshine.

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.

    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "You know, The White Hart is showing the game tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The King's Head is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jack Taylor -- "Aye, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but wouldn't it be more fun to try somewhere a bit different? Maybe somewhere with a bit more...
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit restless.
          current daily occupation: likely a retired individual who enjoys socializing with friends and seeking out novel experiences.
          core characteristics: a restless and impulsive individual who craves excitement and novelty. He enjoys spontaneity and dislikes routine, preferring unpredictable experiences and environments. He values camaraderie and shared experiences with his friends but is not overly dependent on their presence for enjoyment. While he appreciates the comfort of familiarity, he is always seeking out new and stimulating experiences.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a restless and impulsive individual who craves excitement and novelty.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they watch the game at a different pub, perhaps one with a more lively atmosphere and a less predictable vibe.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in playful banter with his friends, subtly steering the conversation towards his preferred pub choice.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest a pre-game activity, something spontaneous and exciting, like a quick game of frisbee in the park or a visit to a quirky local shop.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head to the chosen pub, enjoying the walk and the anticipation of the game.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Secure a good spot at the pub, order drinks and snacks, and settle in for an evening of fun and camaraderie.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob to ditch their plans for a quiet night at The White Hart and join him on a spontaneous road trip. With only a vague destination in mind and a car full of youthful exuberance, they drove through the night, fueled by cheap beer and the promise of adventure. The reckless abandon of the journey, the shared laughter and whispered secrets, cemented their bond and fed Alexander's insatiable hunger for experience.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

          Value

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit restless.
          current daily occupation: likely a retired individual who enjoys socializing with friends and seeking out novel experiences.
          core characteristics: a restless and impulsive individual who craves excitement and novelty. He enjoys spontaneity and dislikes routine, preferring unpredictable experiences and environments. He values camaraderie and shared experiences with his friends but is not overly dependent on their presence for enjoyment. While he appreciates the comfort of familiarity, he is always seeking out new and stimulating experiences.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing in Victoria Park with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest a more exciting activity or a change of venue.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they watch the game at a different pub, perhaps one with a more lively atmosphere and a less predictable vibe.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in playful banter with his friends, subtly steering the conversation towards his preferred pub choice.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest a pre-game activity, something spontaneous and exciting, like a quick game of frisbee in the park or a visit to a quirky local shop.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head to the chosen pub, enjoying the walk and the anticipation of the game.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Secure a good spot at the pub, order drinks and snacks, and settle in for an evening of fun and camaraderie.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head for the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head for the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The King's Head is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jack Taylor -- "Aye, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but wouldn't it be more fun to try somewhere a bit different? Maybe somewhere with a bit more...
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The White Hart is showing the game tonight.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head for the game tonight?"

Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head for the game tonight?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The King's Head to his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The King's Head to his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head for the game tonight?"

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The King's Head is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jack Taylor -- "Aye, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but wouldn't it be more fun to try somewhere a bit different? Maybe somewhere with a bit more...
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The White Hart is showing the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head for the game tonight?"


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely retired and enjoys spending time with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit underwhelmed.
          core characteristics: a restless and impulsive individual who craves excitement and novelty, particularly when it comes to spending time with friends and watching sports. He is sociable and enjoys unpredictable experiences.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a restless and sociable individual who craves excitement and novelty, particularly when it comes to spending time with friends and watching sports.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they watch the game at a different pub, perhaps one with a more lively atmosphere and a less predictable vibe.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in playful banter with his friends, subtly steering the conversation towards his preferred pub choice.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest a pre-game activity, something spontaneous and exciting, like a quick game of frisbee in the park or a visit to a quirky local shop.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head to the chosen pub, enjoying the walk and the anticipation of the game.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Secure a good spot at the pub, order drinks and snacks, and settle in for an evening of fun and camaraderie.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alexander White spent a pleasant day with friends at the park and later watched a soccer game at The White Hart pub. He enjoys socializing with his friends, particularly William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a coffee and pastries with friends at a bustling market.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alexander White spent a pleasant day with friends at the park and later watched a soccer game at The White Hart pub. He enjoys socializing with his friends, particularly William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a restless and sociable individual who enjoys excitement and novelty, particularly when it comes to spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a restless and sociable individual who craves excitement and novelty, particularly when it comes to spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a coffee and pastries with friends at a bustling market.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to a lively pub to watch the game later tonight.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they watch the game at a different pub, perhaps one with a more lively atmosphere and a less predictable vibe.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in playful banter with his friends, subtly steering the conversation towards his preferred pub choice.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest a pre-game activity, something spontaneous and exciting, like a quick game of frisbee in the park or a visit to a quirky local shop.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head to the chosen pub, enjoying the walk and the anticipation of the game.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Secure a good spot at the pub, order drinks and snacks, and settle in for an evening of fun and camaraderie.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a restless and sociable individual who enjoys excitement and novelty, particularly when it comes to spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a restless and sociable individual who craves excitement and novelty, particularly when it comes to spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a coffee and pastries with friends at a bustling market.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to a lively pub to watch the game later tonight.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The King's Head is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jack Taylor -- "Aye, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but wouldn't it be more fun to try somewhere a bit different? Maybe somewhere with a bit more...
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The White Hart is showing the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head for the game tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely enjoying a coffee and pastry with his friends at a bustling market.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and looking forward to spending time with his friends while watching the game.
          core characteristics: a calm, focused, and friendly individual who values his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like spending time with loved ones, watching football, and having a good time at his favorite pub, The King's Head.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value

          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He is generally easygoing about who attends but would prefer to share the experience with his friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a calm and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the excitement of the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a friendly and easygoing person who enjoys simple pleasures like spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a coffee and pastries with his friends at a bustling market.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends, the coffee, pastries, and the lively atmosphere of the market.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The King's Head to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Arrive at The King's Head, secure a table, and order drinks.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Enjoy the game with friends, cheering on their preferred team.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.

          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game, it has a great atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game, it has a great atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The King's Head is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jack Taylor -- "Aye, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but wouldn't it be more fun to try somewhere a bit different? Maybe somewhere with a bit more...
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The White Hart is showing the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head for the game tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game, it has a great atmosphere.

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: content and sociable.
          current daily occupation: likely a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close friends at pubs, especially to watch games.
          core characteristics: a content and sociable introvert who enjoys spending time with her close friends but also appreciates solitude.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a content and sociable introvert who enjoys spending time with close friends, especially at pubs, but also appreciates solitude.

          Chain of thought
        • Alice Lewis's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          Alice Lewis's
          Recalled memories and observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is a content and sociable introvert who enjoys spending time with close friends, especially at pubs, but also appreciates solitude.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a pleasant morning at a market with her friends.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the lively atmosphere of the market.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a content and sociable introvert who enjoys spending time with close friends, especially at pubs, but also appreciates solitude.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a pleasant morning at a market with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the lively atmosphere of the market.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest to her friends that they head to The White Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [14 May 2015 12:30] Arrive at The White Hart, settle into a good spot with her friends, and order drinks.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Enjoy the game, cheering on Andorra with her friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game, it has a great atmosphere.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a content and sociable introvert who enjoys spending time with close friends, especially at pubs, but also appreciates solitude.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a pleasant morning at a market with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the lively atmosphere of the market.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "I'm up for The King's Head. It's a good shout, Jack.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "I'm up for The King's Head. It's a good shout, Jack.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The King's Head is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jack Taylor -- "Aye, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but wouldn't it be more fun to try somewhere a bit different? Maybe somewhere with a bit more...
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The White Hart is showing the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head for the game tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game, it has a great atmosphere.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "I'm up for The King's Head. It's a good shout, Jack.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          State

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching football with friends at pubs, but gets disappointed when some friends don't show up.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys watching football with friends at pubs, but gets disappointed when some friends don't show up.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to try out a new pub called The King's Head. The atmosphere was electric with the roar of a football match on the telly, and William, drawn to the camaraderie and excitement, found himself swept up in the energy of the crowd. He cheered along with his friends, mimicking their enthusiasm, and for a brief moment, he felt a sense of belonging that transcended his usual self-doubt.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games at pubs, though they sometimes experience disappointment when their preferred companions don't join them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The King's Head, or they could go along with the suggestion of watching the game at The White Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The King's Head.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "I'm up for The King's Head. It's a good shout, Jack.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game, it has a great atmosphere.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game, it has a great atmosphere.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games at pubs, though they sometimes experience disappointment when their preferred companions don't join them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The King's Head, or they could go along with the suggestion of watching the game at The White Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The King's Head.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head beckons, my friends, a celestial tapestry woven with the threads of victory and camaraderie.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head beckons, my friends, a celestial tapestry woven with the threads of victory and camaraderie.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The King's Head is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jack Taylor -- "Aye, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is alright, but wouldn't it be more fun to try somewhere a bit different? Maybe somewhere with a bit more...
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a lovely day, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "It's a beautiful day, isn't it? Makes you want to just soak up the sun.
      Jacob Walker -- "The sun whispers secrets to the grass, but only the patient hear its wisdom.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The White Hart is showing the game tonight.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head for the game tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, anyone up for catching the game at a different pub tonight? Maybe somewhere with a bit more buzz?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head for the game tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game, it has a great atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "I'm up for The King's Head. It's a good shout, Jack.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head beckons, my friends, a celestial tapestry woven with the threads of victory and camaraderie.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sporting events.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling refreshed and energized and is currently at a market with friends, discussing where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market and discussing plans for the evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be engaged in conversation with his friends, perhaps discussing the upcoming game and deciding where to watch it.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head beckons, my friends, a celestial tapestry woven with the threads of victory and camaraderie.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sporting events.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market and discussing plans for the evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be engaged in conversation with his friends, perhaps discussing the upcoming game and deciding where to watch it.
